title: Mert Girmalegesse
text:
Mert Girmalegesse, formerly Shimelis Girma (<a href="Amharic">Amharic</a>), then Selim Bayrak (<a href="Turkish%20language">Turkish</a>), (born November 30, 1987) is an Ethiopian born Turkish <a href="Middle%20distance%20track%20event">middle</a> and <a href="Long-distance%20track%20event">long distance track and field</a> <a href="sportsperson">athlete</a>, running in the disciplines of <a href="3000%20m">3000 m</a>, <a href="5000%20m">5000 m</a> and also <a href="10000%20m">10000 m</a>.
Personal life.
Born and raised in Ethiopia, he transferred to Turkey for an amount of US$1 million. On May 15, 2008, he received Turkish citizenship and changed his name to Selim Bayrak. Two years later, he took the name Mert and changed his surname to Gırmalegese, his family's name in Ethiopia. For the reason of the repeated name change he stated that he wants to safeguard interests in his country of origin.
Sports career.
In 2008, he won the <a href="5000%20m">5000 m</a> at the <a href="2008%20European%20Cup%20%28athletics%29%23First%20League">2008 European Cup First League</a> group B competitions in <a href="Istanbul">Istanbul</a>. In the same year he was third at the <a href="2008%20European%20Cross%20Country%20Championships%23Men%20U23%20individual%208.0km">European Cross Country Championships</a> in his own age category of men under 23 years (U23).
He finished eleventh in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202008%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%2010000%20metres">10000 m</a> at the <a href="2008%20Summer%20Olympics">2008 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a> with 27:29.33 and did not start in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202008%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%205000%20metres">5000 m</a> qualification heat 3.
In 2009, he won the <a href="10000%20m">10000 m</a> at the <a href="2009%20European%20Athletics%20U23%20Championships">2009 European Athletics U23 Championships</a> in <a href="Kaunas">Kaunas</a> and also won bronze in the <a href="10000%20m">10000 m</a> at the <a href="2009%20Mediterranean%20Games">2009 Mediterranean Games</a> in <a href="Pescara">Pescara</a>.
At the <a href="2009%20European%20Athletics%20Indoor%20Championships">2009 European Athletics Indoor Championships</a> he competed in <a href="3000%20m">3000 m</a> and finished fifth in <a href="Torino">Torino</a>.
He is a member of the <a href="Fenerbah%C3%A7e%20Athletics">Fenerbahçe S.K.</a> athletics club.
